New Records: Glenn Phillips scored the fastest century in a T20 World Cup match for New Zealand
Key Match Events: Tim Southee and Trent Boult broke the back of the Lankan chase to reduce Sri Lanka to 8 for 4 inside the powerplay
Glenn Phillips and Daryll Mitchell put together a partnership, and it was an incredible knock to get a very very good total on this surface
Dasun Shanaka and Bhanuka Rajapaksa were at the crease, but the ask by that point seemed always beyond them
Trent Boult took 4 wickets for 13 runs, including 2 in the powerplay, to help New Zealand restrict Sri Lanka's chase
Glenn Phillips scored 104 runs off 64 balls, including 8 fours and 1 six, to help New Zealand post a competitive total
Pre-Game Insights: Kane Williamson mentioned that the wicket was different to what they were expecting, and it was tennis ball-ey and got stuck on the surface
Fleming: Possibly the strongest squad New Zealand have ever had
Moody: Don't be surprised by a surprise result today
Fleming: Mitchell's inclusion not straightforward but makes sense
Fleming: Mitchell Santner is like Daniel Vettori
Post-Match Reflections: Kane Williamson praised Glenn Phillips' innings, saying it was an incredible knock to get a very very good total on this surface
Dasun Shanaka said that credit to Glenn Phillips who played an outstanding knock, and they also dropped a few catches
Kane Williamson mentioned that trying to make adjustments on the same sort of grounds is important, and Sri Lanka were also really good at the top
Miscellaneous Highlights: The points table should be updated shortly, and remember, tomorrow is a triple header with BanvZim, NedvPak and IndvSA all taking place
The wicket was different to what New Zealand were expecting, and it was tennis ball-ey and got stuck on the surface
Glenn Phillips outscores Sri Lanka in New Zealand's huge win
Others: Vishal Kalwani asked if SL knocked out of the world cup after this loss, and Rohit replied that they still have an outside chance
Haider Khan mentioned that despite winning by over 60 runs, NZ will have a loss of NRR
Karthik R praised the Kiwis, saying they are a super side right now, and won the WTC trophy, made finals of 2019 ODI WC, finalists of 2021 T20 WC and this edition of T20 WC
